display_asset.caption: Washington College in Chestertown, Md., closed its campus earlier this week after a student who may have a rifle disappeared.
display_asset.credit: Matt Roth for The New York Times

summaries.body: The search for a missing Maryland college student who may be armed has taken a personal turn as people reach out to him in social media posts addressed to “Jacob.”

display_asset.caption: An ancient amulet depicting the Egyptian goddess Isis.

summaries.body: For people, companies and Egyptian deities also named Isis, the association with the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria has created problems, including vandalism.

display_asset.credit: Lucara Diamond Corp / European Pressphoto Agency

summaries.body: A 1,111-carat diamond, a bit smaller than a tennis ball, was found in a mine in Botswana. It's the second largest gem-quality diamond ever discovered.
A Thai waitress in California has gotten an outpouring of tips after an image of one customer's receipt, saying that tips are “for U.S. citizens only," was posted online.

display_asset.caption: Sheldon Harnick is a titan of musical theater, best known for writing the words to “Fiddler on the Roof.” Now he’s 91, and he’s not slowing down.
display_asset.title: A Legendary Lyricist

summaries.body: Sheldon Harnick is a titan of musical theater, best known for writing the words to “Fiddler on the Roof.” Now he’s 91, and he’s not slowing down.

display_asset.caption: The image of a professor at the law school defaced with black tape. The Harvard police were investigating the taping of images on Thursday morning as a hate crime.

summaries.body: Black slashes of tape appeared across the portraits of some African-American law professors at Harvard, which is investigating the incident as a hate crime.
New York City has declared hoverboards to be illegal, since they cannot be registered as vehicles with the state. Users could be fined up to $200.
Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain plans to join the club of world leaders with an official aircraft.
Facebook is making it a little less awkward to manage a breakup online. It is testing tools to help users review past posts and to adjust what they (and their exes) can see.

display_asset.caption: Jonathan Flothow, a steam system specialist, at Kips Bay Court, where about 95 percent of the radiators in one building have been retrofitted.
display_asset.credit: Chang W. Lee/The New York Times

summaries.body: Simple, cheap fixes could make the clanging pipes and radiators in New York buildings more efficient -- and cut carbon emissions -- a new study says.

display_asset.caption: The New York Times film critics review “Carol,” “The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2” and “Legend.”
display_asset.credit: Produced by By AINARA TIEFENTHÄLER and ROBIN LINDSAY

sectionFrontImages.credit: Wilson Webb/The Weinstein Company, via Associated Press

display_asset.title: This Week’s Movies | Nov. 20, 2015

summaries.body: The New York Times film critics review this week's movies, including, “Carol,” “The Hunger Games: Mockingjay Part 2” and “Legend.”
A transgender woman in England was found dead last week in a men's prison. Vicky Thompson had requested a transfer to a women's facility, her friends said.

display_asset.caption: A day after the attacks in Paris, spectators took pictures of the added security at Times Square.
display_asset.credit: Hilary Swift for The New York Times

summaries.body: Diverted flights. Suspicious packages. Increased security. Experts offer advice for coping with stress caused by a recent spate of terror attacks and violence.
The Santa Monica, Calif., police are under scrutiny after a black woman said she was treated as a burglary suspect when she was locked out of her apartment.
The National Institutes of Health will end its support for invasive research on chimpanzees and retire the 50 chimps that it had set aside for future biomedical research.

display_asset.caption: Jared Fogle entering a courthouse in Indianapolis on Thursday.

summaries.body: Jared Fogle, the former Subway spokesman, was sentenced to more than 15 years in prison for trading in child pornography and having sex with underage prostitutes.

display_asset.caption: Adele’s “25,” which will be released Friday, has been highly anticipated throughout the music industry.

summaries.body: Major digital music services like Spotify and Apple Music have been told that Adele's new album, "25," which comes out Friday, will not be available for streaming. Album review.

display_asset.caption: The German liner St. Louis, carrying about 900 German Jewish refugees, was denied entrance to the Havana harbor in 1939. The ship was later denied entrance to the United States and returned to Hamburg, Germany.

summaries.body: As people compare refugees from Syria to Jews who fled Nazi Germany, some historians say that, while the groups are not parallel, there are lessons to be drawn.
The payments processor Square had a positive start on Thursday as its shares opened at $11.20, above the $9 apiece they were priced at Wednesday evening.

display_asset.caption: Gourd seeds, approximately 12,000 years old, recovered from fossilized mastodon dung in Florida.

summaries.body: The wild ancestors of pumpkins, gourds and squash likely would have become extinct along with mastodons, but a new study suggests that humans may have saved them.

display_asset.caption: Demonstrators in front of a north Minneapolis police precinct during a protest Wednesday over the death of Jamar Clark. Mr. Clark was shot by police officers in Minneapolis on Sunday.

summaries.body: The fatal shooting of an unarmed black man by a Minneapolis officer on Sunday led to a tense standoff between the police and protesters Wednesday night.
A recent study of British twins over 10 years showed that fitter legs were strongly linked to fitter brains.

display_asset.caption: The Washington College campus in Chestertown, Md., on Tuesday. The college will remain closed through the Thanksgiving weekend.
display_asset.credit: Matt Roth for The New York Times

summaries.body: Washington College in Chestertown, Md., said it would remain closed until after the Thanksgiving weekend, as the police searched for a student who may have brandished a gun on campus.

display_asset.caption: A guard at the No.1 Detention Center in Beijing in 2012. Chinese officials told a United Nations committee on Wednesday that solitary confinement in prisons was "not a punitive measure."

summaries.body: Chinese officials dismissed allegations of the widespread use of torture, responding to questions from a U.N. panel by affirming their commitment to eliminating the practice.
A state court judge in San Francisco on Wednesday ordered the destruction of five embryos after a man challenged his ex-wife’s right to use them.

posts.footer: The New York Times book critic, via Twitter

summaries.body: National Book Award's Non-fiction prize: "Between the World and Me" by Ta-Nehisi Coates. My review: https://t.co/3d9SMyjybA
A Texas inmate, Raphael Holiday, was executed for setting a fire that killed his 18-month-old daughter and her two young half-sisters at an East Texas home 15 years ago.

display_asset.caption: Sepp Blatter will remain suspended from his job for now.

summaries.body: FIFA rejected appeals by Sepp Blatter, the group's leader, and Michel Platini, president of the European soccer confederation, challenging their 90-day suspensions.
The Cubs' Jake Arrieta, above, won the National League Cy Young Award while the Astros' Dallas Keuchel took the honor in the American League.
Condé Nast will stop publishing Details, a men’s magazine with a circulation of about 560,000, at the end of the year, the company’s president said.
